intro: Billbergia tillandsioides, commonly known as the silver billbergia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, silver-blue leaves that form a central cup. The plant produces inflorescences with striking red bracts and yellow flowers, which attract pollinators such as birds and insects. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil with good air circulation. Billbergia tillandsioides is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
